company.why: A lot of initial convos go well but die on the vine due to budget, timing, feature gap, etc. After some time, these are some of the lowest-hanging fruit to pick up. Even better if you have a new feature to revitalize interest.
company.template: [FirstName], I noticed we spoke [X months] ago about [topic]. Since then, we've added [new feature] that addresses [pain point]. Worth a quick chat?
company.example: 6-month old opportunity → New feature launched → Re-engage with value add

company.why: Hint: The email opens probably aren't coming from just one person. Rather, it's a sign that your email is being passed around to other stakeholders.
company.template: [FirstName], I see there's growing interest in [solution]. Who else should I loop in to discuss how this helps [objective]?
company.example: Email opened 8 times → Multiple stakeholders → Expand conversation

company.why: Sometimes the government steps in and passes legislation that impacts markets. When your product is an easy fix for that change, it's a lot easier to convert a customer or book an intro.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], with [new regulation] taking effect, companies in [industry] need to adapt. Here's how [solution] ensures compliance...
company.example: GDPR launch → Privacy compliance tools → Massive demand spike

company.why: Companies and services have been wiped out by policy changes to distribution platforms (updates to Gmail sender guidelines come to mind). When this happens, it causes fear, uncertainty, and doubt—FUD that your product can potentially curb.
company.template: [FirstName], [Platform] just changed [policy]. Companies using [old method] are at risk. Here's how to adapt...
company.example: Gmail sender requirements → Email deliverability tools → Urgent need

company.why: When competitors sunset their service or get acquired, their customers often reenter the market to refill the gap.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], I know you were using [competitor]. With their recent [acquisition/closure], we're helping former users transition to [solution].
company.example: Competitor acquired → Users need alternative → Perfect timing for outreach

company.why: Reduction in force is a signal of need for efficiency or strategy not working as intended. While often seen as a counter-signal, it can be a positive sign for a need to consolidate technology or bring on a new tool to replace the function of an employee.
company.template: [FirstName], restructuring often means doing more with less. [Solution] helps automate [function] without adding headcount.
company.example: Marketing layoffs → Marketing automation tools → Efficiency play

company.why: Sites like G2 and Trustpilot offer a wealth of reviews from product users. Even if generally positive, reviews often uncover frustrations or limitations of the product. If your product addresses those pain points, it's a good opportunity to reach out or chime in.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], I noticed concerns about [competitor]'s [limitation]. We built [solution] specifically to address this. Here's how...
company.example: Negative review of competitor → Your product solves that issue → Opportunistic outreach

company.why: In addition to abandoning a sign-up flow, form fills and live chats are occasionally abandoned (especially if there's a lag in live chat response time). Dig into it.
company.template: [FirstName], I noticed you started exploring [solution] but didn't finish. What questions can I answer to help you evaluate?
company.example: Demo form 80% complete → Follow-up within 1 hour → Higher completion rate

company.why: Seems obvious, but oftentimes support teams and go-to-market teams don't talk to one another. When a support ticket is created (especially if it's from a high-fit account), it's usually worth a look from the GTM team.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], I saw you reached out about [issue]. This is exactly what [solution] was designed to solve. Quick call?
company.example: Support ticket about integration → Your product has that integration → Sales opportunity

company.why: In the unfortunate scenario that a target account runs into PR trouble, it can be a catalyst for making a change—a change that may require new solutions to address a problem.
company.template: [FirstName], challenging times often require new approaches. [Solution] helps companies in similar situations by [benefit].
company.example: Data breach coverage → Security solutions → Urgent need to rebuild trust

company.why: Hiring is a sign that there's a need to solve a problem. If your product can help, it's a strong signal to connect and show how.
company.template: [FirstName], I saw you're hiring [X] [positions]. This typically signals [challenge]. Here's how [solution] helps scale...
company.example: Hiring 10 SDRs → Sales engagement platform → Scaling infrastructure need

company.why: Tried and true way of surfacing engaged leads—those who click the emails, sign up for the webinars, read the blog posts, watch the videos, etc.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], I noticed you've been reading about [topic]. Thought you'd find [resource] helpful as you evaluate [solution].
company.example: Downloaded 3 whitepapers → High interest → Nurture with personal outreach

company.why: Caution: This one is overused. However, it does mean that scale will follow. That scale could be a strong signal to purchase new software.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], congrats on the [round]! As you scale [function], [solution] helps companies at your stage by [benefit].
company.example: Series B $20M → Scaling sales team → CRM/sales tools opportunity

company.why: While a pretty loose signal, these financial reports can provide insight into a widespread initiative within a target account. It's decent leverage to book a meeting.
company.template: [FirstName], I noticed [initiative] mentioned in your recent earnings call. [Solution] helps companies execute on this by...
company.example: Earnings call mentions AI investment → AI tools → Relevant timing

company.why: Indicates active interest in a product offering and the desire to deepen understanding. Often a sign of a prospect evaluating how the product fits their needs.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], thanks for joining our webinar on [topic]. What questions can I answer as you evaluate [solution]?
company.example: Attended product webinar → Asked questions → High intent for demo

company.signal: New leadership recently hired (CEO, C-level, board)
company.why: Bringing on a new CEO, C-level executive, or board member is a sign that change is happening in the form of new initiatives, new hires, strategy adjustments—all possible triggers where a new technology can help fill a gap.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], congrats on the new [C-level] hire! New leadership often means new initiatives. Here's how [solution] supports...
company.example: New CTO hired → Infrastructure/dev tools → 100-day plan opportunity

company.why: Rare these days, but integrating a new product, team, line of business, etc. is not an easy task. Still, it's one that your product can potentially help with.
company.template: [FirstName], integrating [acquired company] will require [challenge]. [Solution] helps M&A teams by [benefit].
company.example: Acquired competitor → Integration tools → System consolidation need

company.why: Hiring people is a sign that there's a gap that needs to be filled. It's possible that gap can be addressed by your product or that the person to address the gap would benefit from your product.
company.template: [FirstName], I saw you're hiring a [position]. This role typically needs [tool/solution]. Happy to show how [solution] helps...
company.example: Hiring Data Engineer → Data infrastructure tools → Technical buyer identified

company.why: When a target account is recognized (think Cloud 100), or someone within that account is (think 30 under 30), it's an opportunity to send a congrats. Just try to make it relevant.
company.template: Congrats on [award], [FirstName]! Companies at your level often need [solution] for [challenge]. Worth discussing?
company.example: Forbes Cloud 100 → Enterprise-grade solutions → Scale conversation

company.why: When a customer story is made public (especially when that story has hard numbers), it's a good time to share it with prospects in a related space. Even better if they're competitors to the customer featured in the story.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], we just published a case study with [similar company] who achieved [results]. Thought you'd find it relevant given [context].
company.example: Case study with competitor → Share results → FOMO trigger

company.why: Moving into a new market could mean localized copy, policy restrictions (think GDPR), real estate requirements, etc. These are all potential buying triggers.
company.template: [FirstName], expanding to [region] brings [challenges]. Here's how [solution] helps companies scale internationally...
company.example: Expanding to EU → GDPR compliance tools → Regulatory requirement

company.why: When there's a planned price increase or a holiday offer, the deadline offers a reason for a prospect to take action.
company.template: [FirstName], our [offer] expires [date]. Lock in [benefit] before [consequence]. Let's connect?
company.example: Black Friday offer → 48-hour urgency → Limited-time conversion

company.why: When an email sent to a high-fit user bounces, it's worth a look to see what happened. There may have been a change of employment, giving you a reason to connect with a different point of contact.
company.template: Hi [NewContact], I was working with [OldContact] but their email bounced. Are you the right person to discuss [solution]?
company.example: Champion email bounces → Find replacement on LinkedIn → New opportunity

company.why: Recognition in the form of awards, news coverage, tenure, etc. are milestones that can be acknowledged to cater to a contact's ego. Can't hurt, right?
company.template: Congrats on [milestone], [FirstName]! With [achievement], you're probably looking at [next challenge]. Here's how [solution]...
company.example: 5-year work anniversary → Congrats + relevant offer → Relationship building

company.why: A soft signal, but a signal nonetheless. When a prospect or customer is covered by a media outlet (e.g., TechCrunch, Bloomberg, etc.), it provides intel on company direction and can offer up a reason to reach out.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], congrats on the [publication] feature! With [growth mentioned], [solution] could help by [benefit].
company.example: TechCrunch feature → Positive momentum → Ride the wave

company.why: Social proof and envy are strong motivators. When your team publishes a new case study, story, quote, etc., it's an opportunity to reach out to similar accounts and the direct competition.
company.template: [FirstName], we just helped [competitor/similar company] achieve [results]. Given your similar [context], thought you'd want to see how.
company.example: Competitor case study → Share with their competition → Competitive trigger

company.why: When contracts are up for renewal (especially with competitors), it's the perfect time to present an alternative or upsell.
company.template: [FirstName], with your [competitor] contract renewing soon, now's the time to evaluate alternatives. Here's what makes [solution] different...
company.example: Salesforce renewal in 60 days → Alternative CRM pitch → Decision window

company.why: When executives publicly discuss challenges, they're essentially broadcasting buying intent for solutions to those problems.
company.template: Hi [FirstName], I heard [Executive] mention [challenge] in their [podcast/interview]. [Solution] specifically addresses this by...
company.example: CEO talks about scaling issues on podcast → Infrastructure tools → Public pain point

company.why: QBRs are decision-making moments. Showing up with relevant data right before a QBR can influence priorities and budgets.
company.template: [FirstName], I know you have QBR coming up. Here's data showing how [solution] impacts [KPI] that might be useful...
company.example: Q4 QBR scheduled → ROI data → Budget allocation timing

company.why: Physical expansion often means technology needs change - new infrastructure, more licenses, security requirements, etc.
company.template: [FirstName], expanding to [new office] means [infrastructure needs]. Here's how [solution] scales with you...
company.example: New office opening → Network/infrastructure tools → Expansion budget

person.why: Tried and true, when a customer or champion moves to another company, there's a good chance they'll bring your product along for the journey. If you keep in touch, that is.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], congrats on the new role at [company]! As [role], you'll probably want to set up [solution] like you had at [old company].
person.example: Champion moves to new company → Bring solution with them → Easiest sale ever

person.why: Chatting with someone who recently left (or was let go) from a competitor presents an opportunity to get intel on churn risks, upcoming renewals, key points of context, and more.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], saw you recently left [competitor]. I'd love to learn about your experience with [topic] there. Coffee chat?
person.example: Former competitor employee → Insider intel + potential champion → Competitive intelligence

person.why: New employees want to make an impact. When an ideal persona lands at a target account, it's an opportunity to get in the mix of their ideal tech stack.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], congrats on joining [company]! As new [role], you'll need [solution] to [achieve goal]. Happy to show you how...
person.example: New VP of Sales hired → Sales tools → First 90 days budget

person.why: So the economic buyer at a target account was just featured on a podcast? Seems like a good trigger to send a congrats and show you're a fan.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], loved your insights on [podcast] about [topic]. What you said about [point] really resonated. At [company], we...
person.example: Executive on industry podcast → Personalized outreach → Relationship building

person.why: Follow key people at target accounts on social channels. When they post, like it, engage in the convo, and help amplify. It keeps you top of mind and increases the chances of getting that intro call booked.
person.template: [Engaging comment on their post] + By the way, [FirstName], this connects to [solution] which might interest you given [context].
person.example: LinkedIn post about challenge → Thoughtful comment + DM → Warm introduction

person.why: Not all job change prospects move organizations. When a customer or ideal prospect gets a promotion, it's often a sign that the team is growing, they'll have additional budget, and that they'll be looking to make a fast impact.
person.template: Congrats on the promotion, [FirstName]! As [new role], you now oversee [scope]. Here's how [solution] helps at that scale...
person.example: Manager promoted to Director → Bigger budget + scope → Upsell opportunity

person.why: Like professional milestones, personal wins like an alma mater sports championship, birthday, vacation, etc. are sometimes made public. When the occasion calls for it, it's a chance to show you're paying attention and stand out from the pack.
person.template: [FirstName], congrats on [milestone]! Hope you're celebrating. When you're back, would love to discuss [relevant topic].
person.example: Work anniversary post → Congrats + schedule call → Relationship nurture

person.why: When your target is speaking at an event, it's a perfect icebreaker and shows you're tracking their thought leadership.
person.template: [FirstName], excited to hear your talk on [topic] at [event]. Your perspective on [point] is spot on. Let's connect there?
person.example: Speaking at SaaStr → Attend talk → In-person meeting setup

person.why: When prospects publish content, they're signaling what they care about. Engaging authentically shows you did your homework.
person.template: [FirstName], your article on [topic] was insightful, especially [specific point]. We see similar challenges with clients using [solution]...
person.example: Published blog about scaling → Comment + reach out → Thought leader connection

person.why: LinkedIn profile updates often signal role changes, new priorities, or strategic shifts that create opportunities.
person.template: [FirstName], noticed your updated focus on [new area]. This aligns perfectly with [solution]. Let's discuss?
person.example: Bio now mentions 'digital transformation' → Relevant solution → Strategic alignment

person.why: Joining industry groups signals active engagement and potential buying cycle initiation.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], saw you joined [group]. I'm a member too! Companies in [industry] often need [solution] for [challenge]...
person.example: Joined 'SaaS CFO Forum' → Financial tools → Peer-influenced decision

person.why: Learning signals that someone is building skills for new initiatives or solving current challenges.
person.template: Congrats on completing [certification], [FirstName]! Implementing [skill] often requires [solution]. Happy to share best practices...
person.example: AWS certification → Cloud infrastructure tools → Technical initiative

person.why: Event attendance shows active research phase and openness to new solutions.
person.template: [FirstName], saw you attended [event]. What was your biggest takeaway? We often help companies implement [related solution]...
person.example: Attended Dreamforce → Salesforce ecosystem tools → Buying research phase

person.why: Highest intent signal - they're actively evaluating and comparing solutions.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], thanks for requesting a demo! I'd love to understand [use case] to make our time together valuable. Quick pre-call?
person.example: Demo request → Qualify needs → Personalized presentation

person.why: Content downloads signal research on specific topics and problems they're trying to solve.
person.template: Hi [FirstName], I saw you downloaded [resource]. As you evaluate [topic], here's additional insight on [related area]...
person.example: Downloaded 'Sales Automation Guide' → Sales tools → Education to sales transition

tech.why: Whether your product is complementary or competition, getting a peek at a company's tech stack configuration will help you stand out with value and show empathy with pain points.
tech.template: [FirstName], I saw you're using [adjacent tool]. Great choice! [Solution] integrates perfectly to [benefit]. Demo?
tech.example: Using Salesforce → Propose Salesforce integration → Perfect fit conversation

tech.why: If competitors stop supporting features or deprecate product lines, everyone who gets value from those features is now in the market for a new offering.
tech.template: [FirstName], I know [competitor] is deprecating [feature] that you use. [Solution] not only replaces it but adds [improvement].
tech.example: Google deprecates feature → Alternative solution → Forced migration opportunity

tech.why: Just like adding an integration to a tech stack is a signal of intent, the same goes for removal. It could mean the stripped tool was not adding value as intended and is being replaced for something more feature rich.
tech.template: [FirstName], noticed you removed [integration]. Looking for better [functionality]? [Solution] offers [improvement]...
tech.example: Removed Zapier integration → Native integration tool → Better solution available

tech.why: Technology stack changes often signal larger strategic initiatives or growing pains that need solving.
tech.template: [FirstName], saw you migrated to [new tech]. Companies making this move often need [solution] for [challenge]...
tech.example: Migrated to Shopify → E-commerce tools → Platform-specific solutions

tech.why: This shows an initiative to understand user behavior and demographics of users on a web property. It's often tied to a marketing or growth lead joining a company.
tech.template: [FirstName], noticed you added [analytics tool]. Growing focus on data? [Solution] complements this by [benefit]...
tech.example: Added Google Analytics → Marketing attribution tools → Data-driven initiative

tech.signal: Advertising tracking tag added to website
tech.why: This shows an initiative to scale GTM channel investment and track conversion from that investment. This behavior is often driven by demand gen or marketing ops roles.
tech.template: [FirstName], saw you're scaling paid advertising. [Solution] helps optimize [metric] from your ad spend...
tech.example: Added Facebook Pixel → Ad optimization tools → Performance marketing push

tech.why: A significant update or complete overhaul of a prospect's website signals a strategic shift or a new direction in their go-to-market approach.
tech.template: [FirstName], love the new website! This level of investment in digital presence suggests [initiative]. [Solution] supports this by...
tech.example: Full website redesign → Web experience tools → Digital transformation

tech.why: When target accounts launch a new product, it's a signal that could mean a change in strategy, a new line of hiring, or a new set of customers they can sell to.
tech.template: Congrats on launching [product], [FirstName]! Scaling [product] will require [solution] for [challenge].
tech.example: Launched new product line → Infrastructure tools → Scaling needs

tech.signal: Surge or decline in website traffic
tech.why: Website traffic in either direction can be a signal of pent up demand (rapid growth) or cause for concern (rapid churn). If your product is priced on traffic, it's a signal to reach out and offer support.
tech.template: [FirstName], noticed [traffic change]. Whether scaling up or optimizing, [solution] helps by [benefit]...
tech.example: Traffic doubled → Performance optimization tools → Scaling pains

tech.why: App launches signal investment in mobile-first strategy and create new technical and operational needs.
tech.template: [FirstName], congrats on the mobile app launch! Mobile-first companies often need [solution] for [mobile-specific challenge]...
tech.example: iOS app released → Mobile analytics/testing tools → New platform requirements

product.why: Visits to the pricing page—especially when those visits have a lot of toggling and activity—are often a signal of purchase consideration.
product.template: [FirstName], I see there's interest in [solution]. What questions can I answer about pricing and packaging to help your decision?
product.example: Pricing page visited 5 times → High buying intent → Strike while hot

product.why: Spikes in product usage over a short period of time indicate rapid product adoption (or an organization running a proof of concept). It's worth looking into.
product.template: [FirstName], amazing to see usage spike! As you scale, you might hit [limit]. Let's discuss [upgrade/solution]...
product.example: Usage increased 300% → Upsell opportunity → Capacity planning

product.why: While compliance and IT users are not typically economic buyers or champions, they're tasked with making sure products meet security and cost benchmarks. This is usually a strong buying signal.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], I see IT/compliance is evaluating [solution]. Happy to provide [security docs/compliance info] to help your review...
product.example: CISO logged in → Security review → Purchasing approval stage

product.signal: Rapid rise and fall in product usage
product.why: A common enterprise product selection tactic is to run a high-scale test (think connecting a streaming data workload) to assess product performance and UX. You might be getting evaluated.
product.template: [FirstName], noticed usage spike then drop. Was that a POC? I'd love to get feedback and address any concerns...
product.example: Stress test pattern → Competitor comparison → Evaluation phase

product.signal: Multiple workspaces created by single org
product.why: When there are multiple sign-ups from different departments as the same organization, it's a sign to follow up on a potential consolidation or upsell.
product.template: [FirstName], I noticed [department A] and [department B] are both using [solution] separately. Let's consolidate for better pricing and management...
product.example: 3 departments using free plan → Enterprise consolidation → Volume discount

product.why: Feature requests show what's blocking adoption or preventing expansion. These are golden opportunities.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], thanks for the [feature] request! We're actually building this for [release date]. Let me show you what's coming...
product.example: Requested API access → API launching soon → Perfect timing for upsell

product.why: Trial extensions indicate genuine interest but potential blockers - budget, buy-in, or technical issues.
product.template: [FirstName], happy to extend your trial! What's blocking the decision? Let me help address [concern]...
product.example: Needs 2 more weeks → Waiting for budget approval → Close to conversion

product.why: Heavy documentation usage shows technical evaluation and implementation planning.
product.template: [FirstName], saw you're deep in the docs! Any questions about implementing [feature]? Happy to connect you with our solutions team...
product.example: Read API docs for 2 hours → Technical buyer → Implementation phase

product.why: Video completion rates show genuine interest and help identify what features matter most.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], glad you watched our [feature] video! That's our most popular use case. Want to see it in action with your data?
product.example: Watched integration video → Specific need identified → Targeted demo

product.why: Visiting comparison pages shows active evaluation and consideration of alternatives.
product.template: [FirstName], I see you're comparing [solution] to [competitor]. Here are the 3 key differences that matter for [use case]...
product.example: Read 'vs Competitor' page → Active evaluation → Competitive positioning

product.why: Case study views indicate they're looking for proof and validation from similar companies.
product.template: [FirstName], saw you checked out the [company] case study. They're similar to you in [aspect]. Want to hear how they achieved [result]?
product.example: Read competitor case study → Social proof seeking → Reference call setup

product.why: Using an ROI calculator shows they're building a business case and getting close to decision.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], I see you ran the ROI calculator. Based on your inputs, [solution] could generate [specific value]. Let's refine these numbers together...
product.example: ROI calculation complete → Building business case → Help close internally

product.why: Integration research shows they're thinking about how your product fits their tech stack.
product.template: [FirstName], saw you're looking at integrations. We work great with [their tech stack]. Want to see the [specific integration] in action?
product.example: Checked Salesforce integration → Tech stack fit → Implementation planning

product.why: Security page views indicate enterprise evaluation and compliance requirements.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], I see security is important to you. We're [SOC 2/GDPR/etc] compliant. Want our full security documentation?
product.example: Read security page → Enterprise buyer → Compliance check phase

product.why: Sharing access shows they're getting buy-in from team members and expanding evaluation.
product.template: [FirstName], great to see [colleague] joining! As you expand evaluation, let me know if you want to add more team members or discuss enterprise plans...
product.example: Added 3 team members → Org-wide consideration → Enterprise opportunity

product.why: Data exports can signal either adoption (good) or potential churn (needs attention).
product.template: [FirstName], saw you exported data. Are you integrating this elsewhere, or is something not working? Happy to help...
product.example: Large data export → Either integration or churn risk → Proactive outreach

product.why: API key creation shows technical integration and serious implementation intent.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], excited to see you generated API keys! Need help with implementation? Our dev team can help get you started...
product.example: Created API credentials → Developer involved → Implementation phase

product.why: Cart abandonment in B2B shows price sensitivity or approval needs - both addressable.
product.template: [FirstName], I noticed you started checkout but didn't complete. What questions can I answer? Or need approval help?
product.example: Selected enterprise plan, didn't buy → Possible price objection → Negotiation opportunity

product.why: Repeated views of specific support content shows a pain point or confusion that needs addressing.
product.template: Hi [FirstName], saw you're reading about [topic] a lot. Can I help clarify or show you a better way to [solve problem]?
product.example: Read same article 5 times → Struggling with feature → Onboarding help needed

product.why: Low NPS scores are churn risks that need immediate attention and recovery plans.
product.template: [FirstName], I'm sorry we didn't meet expectations. Can we schedule 30 min to understand what went wrong and how to fix it?
product.example: NPS score of 3 → Churn risk → Executive intervention

community.why: Community engagement shows thought leadership and willingness to help others - perfect champion profile.
community.template: [FirstName], love your contributions in [community]! Your insight on [topic] was spot-on. We help companies with [related challenge]...
community.example: 10+ Slack group answers → Community leader → Champion potential

community.why: Questions in communities are explicit pain points looking for solutions.
community.template: Hi [FirstName], saw your question in [community] about [problem]. We actually built [solution] specifically for this. Happy to show you...
community.example: Asked about integrations → Solution has that → Perfect product-market fit

community.why: Public complaints or frustrations are buying signals in disguise.
community.template: [FirstName], I saw you mention [pain point] in [forum]. We've helped companies solve this exact issue with [solution]...
community.example: Reddit post complaining about tool → Alternative solution → Frustrated buyer

community.why: Upvoting features shows what they need but don't have in current tools.
community.template: Hi [FirstName], I see [feature] matters to you. [Solution] has this built-in. Want to see how it works?
community.example: Upvoted 'better reporting' → Product has advanced analytics → Feature-led pitch

community.why: Joining competitor communities shows active evaluation or current usage with potential pain points.
community.template: [FirstName], saw you joined [competitor community]. If you ever need a comparison or alternative, [solution] offers [differentiation]...
community.example: Joined HubSpot community → HubSpot user → Competitive intel

community.why: Sharing competitor content shows awareness of category and research behavior.
community.template: [FirstName], saw you shared [competitor]'s content on [topic]. We do [topic] differently by [unique approach]. Interested in comparing?
community.example: Shared Gong content → Sales tech interested → Competitor awareness

community.why: Blog comments show active research and thought process on relevant topics.
community.template: Hi [FirstName], great comment on [blog post] about [topic]. This aligns with [solution]'s approach. Want to discuss?
community.example: Commented on 'Best CRMs 2024' → CRM evaluation → Active buyer

community.why: Reviews show first-hand experience and often reveal what they wish the product had.
community.template: [FirstName], I read your [competitor] review. You mentioned wanting [feature they lack]. [Solution] has this built-in. Demo?
community.example: Reviewed competitor, wanted better UX → Product has better UX → Switching opportunity

community.why: Conference attendance shows heavy investment in category and potential expansion needs.
community.template: [FirstName], how was [competitor conference]? As you think about [topic from event], [solution] offers [complementary value]...
community.example: Attended Salesforce Dreamforce → Ecosystem partner → Complementary tool pitch

community.why: Social engagement patterns reveal interests, priorities, and peer influences.
community.template: [FirstName], saw you shared [influencer]'s take on [topic]. We think about this similarly at [company]. Here's our approach...
community.example: Retweeted Jason Lemkin on SaaS metrics → SaaS tool buyer → Thought leadership connection

community.why: Newsletter subscriptions show ongoing interest in category and competitor monitoring.
community.template: Hi [FirstName], I see you follow [competitor content]. We publish similar insights on [topic]. Want our perspective?
community.example: Subscribed to Drift newsletter → Conversational marketing → Category interest

community.why: Social follows indicate awareness and potential evaluation of alternatives.
community.template: [FirstName], I notice you follow [competitor]. If you're evaluating [category], [solution] differentiates by [unique value]...
community.example: Followed 3 competitors → Active research → Comparison opportunity

community.why: Content downloads from competitors show active problem-solving and solution research.
community.template: Hi [FirstName], saw you're researching [topic]. Our [competing resource] offers a different take. Want both perspectives?
community.example: Downloaded 'Sales Playbook' from competitor → Sales tools → Alternative option

community.why: Webinar participation shows high engagement and active evaluation of solutions.
community.template: [FirstName], how was [competitor]'s webinar on [topic]? We approach [topic] differently by [approach]. Want to compare?
community.example: Attended Zoom webinar → Video conferencing evaluation → Alternative demo

community.why: Being tagged or mentioned shows you're relevant to their network and challenges.
community.template: [FirstName], thanks for the mention in your discussion about [topic]! Happy to expand on [solution]'s approach to this...
community.example: Tagged in LinkedIn discussion → Relevant to their challenge → Inbound interest

event.why: Event registration shows active engagement in industry and openness to conversations.
event.template: [FirstName], see you at [event]! Want to grab coffee and discuss [relevant topic]?
event.example: Registered for SaaStr → Schedule meeting → In-person connection

event.why: Speakers are influential and highly engaged - perfect prospects or champions.
event.template: [FirstName], excited for your [event] talk on [topic]! This aligns with [solution]. Can we connect at the event?
event.example: Speaking at conference → Attend talk → VIP meeting setup
